sub_topic: Calculation of Carnot efficiency of a heat engine
message_1: A Carnot heat engine operates between two heat reservoirs at temperatures 300 K and 600 K respectively. Calculate the maximum efficiency of the engine if it absorbs heat at a rate of 400 J/s. Also, calculate the rate at which it rejects heat to the low-temperature reservoir.
message_2:
The maximum efficiency of a Carnot heat engine is given by the formula:

Efficiency = 1 - (T_low / T_high)

where T_low and T_high are the temperatures of the low-temperature and high-temperature reservoirs, respectively. In this case, T_low = 300 K and T_high = 600 K.

Efficiency = 1 - (300 K / 600 K) = 1 - 0.5 = 0.5 or 50%

Now, we know that the engine absorbs heat at a rate of 400 J/s. To find the rate at which it converts this heat into work, we can use the formula:

Work rate = Efficiency × Heat absorption rate

Work rate = 0.5 × 400 J/s = 200 J/s

The engine converts 200 J/s of the absorbed heat into work. The remaining heat is rejected to the low-temperature reservoir. To find the rate at which the engine rejects heat, we can use the formula:

Heat rejection rate = Heat absorption rate - Work rate

Heat rejection rate = 400 J/s - 200 J/s = 200 J/s

So, the maximum efficiency of the Carnot heat engine is 50%, and it rejects heat to the low-temperature reservoir at a rate of 200 J/s.
